meanings.definition: To renovate or redecorate (a room or building)
meanings.sent1: We will refurbish the old house by painting the walls and fixing the floors.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to refurbish their office space to create a more modern look.
meanings.sent3: After a long day of work, the tired painters joked that they could refurbish the entire city in a week.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a refurbishing touch, brightening up the room with warmth and joy.
meanings.sent5: The sound of hammers and drills echoed through the house as they worked to refurbish it.

meanings.definition: To clean, repair, or restore (something) to good condition
meanings.sent1: The mechanic will refurbish the old car to make it run smoothly again.
meanings.sent2: She decided to refurbish her favorite dress instead of buying a new one.
meanings.sent3: The idea of refurbishing the broken toy with glitter and stickers made the child giggle.
meanings.sent4: His kindness towards others seemed to refurbish their faith in humanity.
meanings.sent5: The old clock ticked happily after being refurbished by the skilled clockmaker.
